clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of Peri-implant Mucositis With Difference Severity by Means of Non-surgical Subgingival Debridement
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Peri-implant Mucositis With Difference Severity by Means of Non-surgical Subgingival Debridement

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed as single center non-randomized prospective comparative study .
Patients with at least one implants with peri-implant mucositis and allocated in three groups. The implants will be allocated in three groups and treated by means of subgingival scaling using sonic instrument with plastic tip.

detailed_description.textblock:
Group A: Presence of BOP-positive within 30 sec (drop or line) at 1-2 sites/implant.
Group B: Presence of BOP-positive within 30 sec (drop or line) at 3-4 sites/implant.
Group C: Presence of BOP-positive within 30 sec (drop or line) at 5-6 sites/implant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- age ≥ 18 years
- non-smokers and smokers ≤ 10 cigarettes/day
- subjects with gingivitis or treated periodontal conditions (i.e., absence of residual PPD > 5 mm), peri-implant mucositis defined as ≥ 1 implant site with presence of BoP and absence of radiographic bone loss compared with a previous radiograph16 ,implant-supported fixed dental prostheses.
Exclusion criteria:
- presence of medical conditions contraindicating treatment of peri-implant mucositis,
- regular use of anti-inflammatory drugs or antibiotics within 3 months prior to study enrollment
- pregnant or lactating females
- removable implant-supported dental prostheses
- prothesis reconstruction with visible gap between abutment and supra-structure,
- peri-implantitis, defined as inflammation in the peri-implant mucosa with concomitant loss of supporting bone .
